overview_of_class: This course examines the theory underlying the construction of a financial assets portfolio with the objective of maximizing expected return for a specified tolerable level of risk. Topics covered include, among others, risk aversion and utility functions; diversification; theMarkowitz Mean-Variance Portfolio Theory; the Black-Litterman variation of this model; the Capital Asset Pricing Model; index models; multifactor models of risk and return, including the Arbitrage Pricing Theory Model; the efficient market hypothesis; and behavioral finance. Although some of these topics are covered briefly in FINANCE 202, the focus in this course is on a more in-depth analysis of the underlying assumptions of these models.
name: Investment Theory
